page.title: 11THE FARMERS YEAR CONT
page.content: { {scab. In the middle of{June}the sheep are sheared. The farmer and his men start with the young lambs and old sheep that haven't had lambs. This is because their wool grows more quickly,when they are not producing milk.About a fortnight later the other sheep are clipped, and dipped to prevent scab, which is a disease caused by a mite. The{Police}always attend such dippings. The ground has to be ploughed for crops like rape which is grown for fattening lambs.{Rape}is sown in{June}and is ready for eating in August. In{July}the men are starting to make{hay}and the grassfields have to be shut off from the sheep so that they can be mowed.The grass is left in
